list_definition.definition: not having a high opinion of oneself etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: You have plenty of ability but you’re too humble.

list_definition.definition: unimportant; having a low position in society etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was humbled by his failure.

list_ex_of_english: And you who walk in humble places, think kindly too, of others.
The degree to which even relatively humble residents participated in the more 'egalitarian' parishes is also noteworthy.
In our age of aggressive visual images and architectural arrogance this is a humble but healing architecture and a rewardingly subtle book.
The grand vistas which now pass as historical understanding have been created and cultivated by the humble labours of the many.
He was humble enough, however, to recognize his own flaws.
What is actually needed is a much less dramatic, somewhat humbler approach.
Transactors of all types (whether globalised construction firms or, indeed, humble local purveyors of meat and vegetables) share certain concerns.
He was humble in that he dedicated himself entirely to the duties which his office demanded from him without any personal gain.
